result.execSummary:
The defendant Jabar NMI Taylor Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: concurrent to Count 2 and consecutive to 22CM1068.

Court recommends the Mental Health Unit of the probation department.
Case is adjourned to 11-18-2022 @ 1:30 pm for a Probation Review Hearing.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
No contact with D.L.G. and S.D.G.

Mental health evaluation and cooperate with any treatment deemed necessary by the probation department.
Complete Batterer's Intervention Program.
Defendant is advised he/she may not possess any firearms.

timeConds.notes: STAYED to be reviewed at the Probation Review Hearing date.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: concurrent to Count 1 and consecutive to 22CM1068.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jabar NMI Taylor Sr

records.addlTxt: Elements of the Offense/ WIS JI - Criminal
Case is retabbed to Judge Havas, Br. 10 on 8-1-22 at 10:30 am for a global resolution plea and sentencing.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant Jabar NMI Taylor not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Case in court for status. 
Defense advises the Court this case mat resolve with a global offer in Branch 10 and requests and adjournment. 
Court orders matter adjourned for status.

Defendant Jabar NMI Taylor in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Jabar NMI Taylor in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests a status conference date. Defendant has pending case in Branch 10. Court will allow transfer of this case to Branch 10 if there is a global resolution. Case adjourned, Branch 30 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Jamar T and Natasha G
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jabar NMI Taylor in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Jabar NMI Taylor in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jabar NMI Taylor appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case retabbed to Branch 30
Lower number case pending.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
